intro: Ceriscoides celebica, commonly known as the Celebes cerisia, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of Indonesia. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae and is characterized by its small, clustered flowers that are typically white or pale yellow. The plant has simple, opposite leaves that are usually elliptical in shape. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in lowland forests. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in botanical gardens and private collections.
